WorkItem.Description: I'd like for my comments to be included with my compiled output as an option to the VS extension. TypeScript HTML applications have a BeforeBuild target that I believe can be manipulated. Including TypeScript files inside an existing application doesn't seem to have an option to be manipulated. Correct me if I am overlooking something.

Comments.Message:
Install Web Essentials for VS 2012. It's free and allows you to control most typescript compile options.

http://visualstudiogallery.msdn.microsoft.com/07d54d12-7133-4e15-becb-6f451ea3bea6
Open the project file in Notepad, search for 'tsc' and add that -c option manually.

@mihailik that doesn't work as my project isn't a TypeScript application. I simply have ts files embedded inside an existing web application.

@ashkandaie this is exactly what I was looking for and more. Thanks! I actually had this extension installed already but didn't know it supported TypeScript options until you mentioned it.
